statement:
Let $H^\infty$ denote the bounded analytic functions on the unit disc.

Every $f \in H^\infty$ can be written as $$f(z) = \alpha I(z) F(z)$$
where $\lvert \alpha \rvert = 1$, $I$ is an inner function and $F$ is a
bounded outer function. Conversely any function which can be so written
is bounded.

[9]{} John B. Conway. [**]{}. Springer-Verlag, New York, New York, 1995.
